Package aima.core.search.uninformed

Class IterativeDeepeningSearch<S,A>

java.lang.Object
aima.core.search.uninformed.IterativeDeepeningSearch<S,A>
All Implemented Interfaces:
aima.core.search.framework.SearchForActions<S,A>, aima.core.search.framework.SearchForStates<S,A>
public class IterativeDeepeningSearch<S,A> extends Object implements aima.core.search.framework.SearchForActions<S,A>, aima.core.search.framework.SearchForStates<S,A>
Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): Figure 3.18, page 89.

 function ITERATIVE-DEEPENING-SEARCH(problem) returns a solution, or failure
   for depth = 0 to infinity  do
     result <- DEPTH-LIMITED-SEARCH(problem, depth)
     if result != cutoff then return result
Figure 3.18 The iterative deepening search algorithm, which repeatedly applies depth-limited search with increasing limits. It terminates when a solution is found or if the depth- limited search returns failure, meaning that no solution exists.
Author:
Ruediger Lunde, Ravi Mohan, Ciaran O'Reilly

    • findActions

      public Optional<List<A>> findActions(aima.core.search.framework.problem.Problem<S,A> p)
      Description copied from interface: aima.core.search.framework.SearchForActions
      Returns a list of actions leading to a goal state if a goal was found, otherwise empty. Note that the list can be empty which means that the initial state is a goal state.
      Specified by:
      findActions in interface aima.core.search.framework.SearchForActions<S,A>
      Parameters:
      p - the search problem
      Returns:
      a (possibly empty) list of actions or empty
